title: Earth and Space Science SP.7.a
prompt: As the earth orbits the sun, the tilt of the earth exposes equatorial regions to direct sunlight more than the poles. This is the primary cause of temperature differences between equatorial regions and the poles. With this in mind, what other phenomena would logically be caused primarily by the earth’s axial tilt?
feedback: The tilt of the earth exposes equatorial regions to direct sunlight more that the poles, which also contributes greatly to seasonal changes on earth. The tilt of the earth changes the angle at which sunlight hits the earth’s surface, which in turn affects how much sunlight energy is imparted to that part of the earth. As the tilt moves to face the sun, warmer seasons result.
